thoracoabdominal aneurysm or dissection: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on imaging and interventional planning for thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysms or dissections, including recommendations for follow-up strategies and repair procedures.
thoracic aorta interventional planning a: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on imaging and interventional planning for diseases of the thoracic aorta, with guidelines for pre- and post-procedural evaluations, including endovascular and surgical approaches.
radiologic management of venous thromboe: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the use and management of inferior vena cava filters for patients with venous thromboembolism, including indications, contraindications, and procedural techniques.
radiologic management of urinary tract o: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and interventional management of urinary tract obstructions, with recommendations for procedures like stenting and percutaneous nephrostomy.
radiologic management of thoracic nodule: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on diagnostic and management strategies for thoracic nodules and masses, including biopsy, imaging follow-ups, and surgical considerations.
radiologic management of portal hyperten: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the radiologic management of portal hypertension, including therapeutic procedures such as transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunts and endoscopic management of variceal bleeding.
radiologic management of mesenteric isch: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and treatment of mesenteric ischemia, with emphasis on endovascular and surgical interventions, as well as systemic therapies.
radiologic management of lower gastroint: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the diagnostic and interventional approaches to lower gastrointestinal bleeding, including imaging modalities, endoscopic interventions, and embolization techniques.
radiologic management of infected fluid: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the management of infected fluid collections, detailing procedures such as percutaneous catheter drainage, surgical options, and imaging follow-ups.
radiologic management of iliofemoral ven: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the management of iliofemoral venous thrombosis, covering anticoagulation, catheter-directed therapies, and surgical interventions.
radiologic management of iliac artery oc: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on imaging and treatment for iliac artery occlusive disease, including recommendations for endovascular and surgical approaches.
radiologic management of gastric varices: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and treatment of gastric varices, with emphasis on therapies like TIPS, endoscopic management, and splenic embolization.
radiologic management of biliary obstruc: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and interventional management of biliary obstructions, with recommendations for endoscopic, percutaneous, and surgical approaches.
management of vertebral compression frac: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and treatment of vertebral compression fractures, including conservative management, percutaneous vertebral augmentation, and surgical options.
management of uterine fibroids: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and treatment of uterine fibroids, covering procedures like uterine artery embolization, myomectomy, and other minimally invasive techniques.
management of liver cancer: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the management of liver cancer, including hepatocellular carcinoma and metastatic liver disease, with guidance on systemic and locoregional therapies.
lower extremity chronic venous disease: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the diagnosis and treatment of chronic venous disease in the lower extremities, addressing interventions like vein ablation, compression therapy, and surgical options.
dialysis fistula malfunction: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on the imaging and treatment of dialysis fistula malfunctions, including fistulography, surgical interventions, and catheter placements.
central venous access device and site se: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on selecting and placing central venous access devices, tailored to the patient's medical needs and treatment duration.
abdominal aortic aneurysm or dissection: Provides information from the American College of Radiology (ACR) appropriateness criteria on imaging and procedural planning for abdominal aortic aneurysms or dissections, with recommendations for endovascular and open surgical approaches.
